Sport Home News Sport Business Innovation Culture Arts Travel Earth Audio Video Live Weather Newsletters News News Asia China India Melbourne ex-childcare worker charged with more child rape offences Alleged paedophile Joshua Dale Brown faces an extra 83 charges with four new victims identified. 11 hrs ago Australia Oil, defence and geopolitics: Why Putin is visiting Modi in Delhi BBC editors explain what is at stake as Russian President Vladimir Putin starts a two-day visit to India. 13 hrs ago World Thailand relaxes afternoon alcohol ban to boost tourism The ban was primarily introduced to stop government employees from drinking during work hours. 1 day ago Asia Cyclone catastrophe in Sri Lanka awakens volunteer spirit Fishing boats deliver relief supplies to flooded suburbs as community kitchens churn out food aid. 2 days ago Asia Meta starts kicking Australian children off Instagram and Facebook The tech giant will begin closing accounts for under 16s, a week before an official ban. 8 hrs ago Australia Hong Kong orders removal of scaffolding mesh after deadly blaze Investigations continue into a fire last week at the Wang Fuk Court housing complex, which killed at least 159 people. 22 hrs ago Asia India scraps order to pre-install state-run cyber safety app on smartphones The order to make the registration mandatory had led to a major backlash from several cyber experts. 1 day ago Asia Indonesia to repatriate two Dutch men, including one on death row The Netherlands requested on humanitarian grounds the return of the men, one of whom is on death row. Chinese and Japanese boats face off near disputed islands as feud worsens Each side claims to have fended off an incursion in the disputed waters near Taiwan. Hong Kong leader orders investigation into deadly fire that killed 151 The fire is the deadliest the city has seen in more than 70 years. India tells smartphone makers to put state-run cyber safety app on new devices India wants all smartphone makers to pre-install new devices with a state-owned cyber security app. Indian student who was stabbed to death in UK is named Vijay Kumar, 30, died from serious injuries after he was found on Barbourne Road, Worcester. Features Australia won't be intimidated by firms over social media ban, minister tells BBC Anika Wells says she is ready to help nations which wish to copy Australia's social media ban for under-16s. Will Australia's social media ban actually work? Australia is banning social media for everyone under the age 16 - here's everything you need to know in 60 seconds. India's Supreme Court upholds rights of poorest - but language reveals 'bias', study says Research into judgements from 1950 to 2025 suggests India's top court often reinforces caste hierarchies in language, even while upholding Dalit rights. Why 2026 will be a year like no other for India's Sun mission For the first time Aditya-L1 will be able to watch the Sun in its maximum activity cycle. Forgotten photos reveal women who powered India's freedom struggle Newly found photos highlight women’s key role in Mahatma Gandhi’s civil disobedience movement against British rule. Latest updates 6 hrs ago More than 300 flights cancelled as Indian airline faces 'staff shortage' Indigo said the disruptions were caused by technical glitches and the impact of updated crew roster rules. 6 hrs ago 7 hrs ago Indian scientists spot Milky Way-like galaxy from 12 billion years ago The galaxy's discovery challenges our understanding of how galaxies were formed in the early period after the Big Bang. 7 hrs ago 8 hrs ago South Korea developing app that shows real-time location of stalkers Critics have voiced concern over the pervasiveness of stalking and violence against women in South Korea. 8 hrs ago 10 hrs ago Singapore court upholds guilty verdict for opposition leader Pritam Singh Singh had appealed against a guilty verdict of lying to a parliamentary committee in 2021. 10 hrs ago 14 hrs ago 'My heart breaks every time I'm called a hero' - Hong Kong fire survivor A survivor tells the BBC he feels guilty he didn't save more people from the blaze at his block of flats. 14 hrs ago 22 hrs ago Hong Kong orders removal of scaffolding mesh after deadly blaze Investigations continue into a fire last week at the Wang Fuk Court housing complex, which killed at least 159 people. 22 hrs ago 24 hrs ago Production halted at Chinese factory making 'childlike' sex dolls The issue is in the spotlight after Shein announced a global ban on the sale of sex dolls with a childlike appearance. 24 hrs ago 1 day ago Thailand relaxes afternoon alcohol ban to boost tourism The ban was primarily introduced to stop government employees from drinking during work hours. 1 day ago 1 day ago India scraps order to pre-install state-run cyber safety app on smartphones The order to make the registration mandatory had led to a major backlash from several cyber experts. 1 day ago ...
